com.geom.MVCControllers

Class OutputUser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.geom.MVCControllers.OutputUser

  • public class OutputUser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class deals with the user inputs e.g when providing coordinates directly in the terminal
    Author:
    Dasha

      static java.awt.geom.Point2D repereScreen(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt, double x, double y)
      Changes the coordinate of a point so that it is expressed in the original frame
      static java.awt.geom.Point2D repereUser(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt, double x, double y)
      Changes the view's frame so that the model is expressed in the user frame The board has its frame that is not whose Y axis pointing down Hence if the user enter (0, 10), the view should actually get (0, -10) Also performs a dilation so that the point are displayed significantly to the user
      static Figure toRepereScreen(Figure figure, double x, double y) 
      static Figure toRepereUser(Figure figure, double x, double y)
      Changes the figure point to set them in the user frame

      • traduction

        public static java.awt.geom.Point2D traduction(java.lang.String coordonnee)

      • repereUser

        public static java.awt.geom.Point2D repereUser(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt,
                                               double x,
                                               double y)
        Changes the view's frame so that the model is expressed in the user frame The board has its frame that is not whose Y axis pointing down Hence if the user enter (0, 10), the view should actually get (0, -10) Also performs a dilation so that the point are displayed significantly to the user
        Parameters:
        pt - Point to project into the new frame
        x - translation abscissa parameter
        y - translation ordinate parameter
        Returns:

        public static java.awt.geom.Point2D repereScreen(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt,
                                                 double x,
                                                 double y)
        Changes the coordinate of a point so that it is expressed in the original frame
        Parameters:
        pt - Point to project into the screen frame
        x - translation abscissa parameter
        y - translation ordinate parameter
        Returns:

      • toRepereUser

        public static Figure toRepereUser(Figure figure,
                                  double x,
                                  double y)
        Changes the figure point to set them in the user frame
        Parameters:
        figure - expressed in an absolute frame
        x - translation abscissa parameter
        y - translation ordinate parameter
        Returns:
        a new figure in the user frame
